siteMetadata.title: Cooking In Pajamas
siteMetadata.description: Stories and Musings from Wayfaring Adventurers and Aspiring Home Cooks.

node.title: Teeny Weenie Itsy Bitsy Cinni Minis
node.plaintext:
I know I know this week I'm kind of skimping out! I have been rushing to get my
week's work done by yesterday so that I can be ready to fully enjoy Coachella
this year! I am currently on my way there and unbelievably excited! I will
report back next week with all the food and excitement!

I had made these Cinnamon buns a while back when I used to make treats for my
coworkers (unfortunately it's been some time since I've done that). I didn't
really experiment too much, more or less made the recipe verbatim. I found this
recipe for simple and quick whole wheat mini cinnamon buns
[http://www.halfbakedharvest.com/whole-wheat-30-minute-mini-cinnamon-buns-and-they-are-healthy/]
.

My chief complaint with this recipe is the fact that whole wheat gives it a
whole different and drier texture. Personally if I were to remake these, I'd
just use normal flour and make smaller size cinnamon buns. They're tiny anyways
so we can splurge on the flour ;)

Let me know what you think!!

node.title: Gettin' your morning BUZZ
node.plaintext:
To be completely honest... this song isn't quite perfect for this post but it
was the first one that came to mind for this post. Enjoy :P

And no, in case you were wondering... I didn't spike these coffee cupcakes with
cocaine.

So, I'm not sure how many of you know this but coffee cake doesn't ACTUALLY 
have any coffee in it... I KNOW! I was just as disappointed as you are right
now. Despite these cakes being a COMPLETE and utter lie, I love them down to the
very last crumb.

Deceit aside, this recipe was actually quite easy to make and also involved me
having to make extra crumble topping to replace the amount I ate. I'd recommend
doing the same for yourself :P hehe



NOTE: My crumble topping came out kind of clumpy but I think that was mainly
because I got lazy and didn't add the ingredients one by one as described in the
recipe. Instead, I decided to add everything at the same time and mix it. It
doesn't really change the taste that much but I imagine the cinnamon sugar taste
is more uniformly present if you make it right.

Since I didn't really make a custom version of this recipe check out the recipe 
here [http://damndelicious.net/2014/03/24/coffee-cake-muffins/].

Try the recipe out yourself and let me know what you think!!!
